gurmukhi: kUkq iPrq kyqy rovq mrq kyqy jl mYN fubq kyqy Awg mYN jrq hYN ]
transliteration: Kookat Phirat Kete Rovat Marat Kete, Jal Main Doubat Kete Aag Main Jarat Hain||
translation: Many cry out while wandering, many weep and many die; many are drowned in water and many are burnt in fire.

gurmukhi: kyqy gMg bwsI kyqy mdInw mkw invwsI kyqk audwsI ky BRmwey eI iPrq hYN ]
transliteration: Kete Gadg Baasoo Kete Madoonaa Makaa Nivaasoo, Ketak Udaasoo Ke Bhramaae Ee Phirat Hain||
translation: Many live on the banks of Ganges and many reside in Mecca and Medina, many becoming hermits, indulge in wanderings.

gurmukhi: krvq shq kyqy BUim mY gfq kyqy sUAw pY cVHq kyqy dUK kau Brq hYN ]
transliteration: Karvat Sahat Kete Bhoom(i) Mai Gadat Kete, Sooaa Pai Chadhat Kete Dookh Hau Bharat Hain||
translation: Many endure the agony of sawing, many get buried in the earth, many are hanged on the gallows and many undergo great angulish.

gurmukhi: gYn mYN aufq kyqy jl mYN rhq kyqy igAwn ky ibhIn jk jwry eI mrq hYN ]19]89]
transliteration: Gadn Main Ounat Kete Jal Main Rahat Kete, Giaan Ke Bihoon Jak Jdare Ee Marat Hain||19||89||
translation: Many fly in the sky, many lives in water and many without knowledge. In their waywardness burn themselves to death. 19.89.

gurmukhi: soD hwry dyvqw ibroD hwry dwno bfy boD hwry boDk pRboD hwry jwpsI ]
transliteration: Sodh Hdare Devtaa Birodh Hdare Daano Bade, Bodh Hdare Odhak Prabodh Hdare Jaapsoo||
translation: The gods got weary of making offerings of fragrances, the antagonistic demons have got weary, he knowledgeable sages have got weary and worshippers of good understanding have also got weary.

gurmukhi: Gs hwry cMdn lgwie hwry coAw cwru pUj hwry pwhn cFwie hwry lwpsI ]
transliteration: Ghas Hdare Channdan Lagade Hdare Choaa Chaar(u), Pooj Hdare Paahan Chadhaae Hdare Laapasoo||
translation: Those who rub sandalwood have got tired, the appliers of fine scent (otto) have got tired, the image-worshippers have got tired and those making offerings of sweet curry, have also got tired.

gurmukhi: gwh hwry gorn mnwie hwry mVHI m`t lIp hwry BIqn lgwie hwry CwpsI ]
transliteration: Gadb Hdare Goran Manaae Hdare Madhoo Matt, Loop Hdare Bhootan Lagade Hdare Chhaadasoo||
translation: The visitors of graveyards have got tired, the worshippers of hermitages and monuments have got tired; those who besmear the walls images have got tired and those who print with embossing seal have also got tired.

gurmukhi: gwie hwry gMDRb bjwie hwry ikMnr sB pc hwry pMfq qpMq hwry qwpwsI ]20]90]
transliteration: Gade Hdare Gaddhrab Bajaae Hdare Kinnar Sabh, Pach Hdare Pandat Tapant Hdare Taapasoo||20||90||
translation: Gandharvas, the musicians of goods have got tired, Kinnars, the players of musical instruments have got tired, the Pundits have got highly weary and the ascetics observing austerities have also got tired. None of the above-mentioned people have been able
BY THY GRACE. BHUJANG PRAYAAT STANZA

gurmukhi: n rwgM n rMgM n rupM n ryKM ]
transliteration: Na Raagadg Na Ranadg, Na Drohan Na Dvaikhan||
translation: The Lord is without an affection, without colour, without form and without line.

gurmukhi: n mohM n kRohM n dRohM n dÍYKM ]
transliteration: Na Moh Na Kroh Na Droh Na Daayvakh
translation: He without attachment, without anger, without deceit and without malice.

gurmukhi: n krmM n BrmM n jnmM n jwqM ]
transliteration: Na Karamannd Na Bharamannd, Na Janamannd Na Jaatan||
translation: He is actionless, illusionless, birthless and casteless.

gurmukhi: n im`qRM n s`qRM n ip`qRM n mwqM ]1]91]
transliteration: Na Mittran Na Sattran, Na Pittran Na Maatan||1||91||
translation: He is sans friend, sans enemy, sans father and sans mother.1.91.

gurmukhi: n nyhM n gyhM n kwmM n DwmM ]
transliteration: Na Nehan Na Gehan, Na Kaamannd Na Dhaamannd||
translation: He is without love, without home, without just and without home.
